031/**
032 * Common utility methods.
033 *
034 * <p>This class contains various static utility methods for working with collections, strings, objects, and other common operations.
035 */
036public class Utils {
037
038   private static final Map<Class<?>,Function<String,?>> ENV_FUNCTIONS = new IdentityHashMap<>();
039
040   static {
041      ENV_FUNCTIONS.put(Boolean.class, Boolean::valueOf);
042      ENV_FUNCTIONS.put(Charset.class, Charset::forName);
043   }
044
045   private static final ConcurrentHashMap<String,String> PROPERTY_TO_ENV = new ConcurrentHashMap<>();
046
047   /**
048    * Creates an array of objects.
049    *
050    * @param <T> The component type of the array.
051    * @param x The objects to place in the array.
052    * @return A new array containing the specified objects.
053    */
054   @SafeVarargs
055   public static <T> T[] a(T...x) {
056      return x;
057   }
058
059   /**
060    * Traverses all elements in the specified object and accumulates them into a list.
061    *
062    * @param <T> The element type.
063    * @param o The object to traverse.
064    * @return A list containing all accumulated elements.
065    */
066   public static <T> List<T> accumulate(Object o) {
067      var l = list();
068      traverse(o, l::add);
069      return (List<T>) l;
070   }
071
072   /**
073    * Shortcut for creating an unmodifiable list out of an array of values.
074    *
075    * @param <T> The element type.
076    * @param values The values to add to the list.
077    * @return An unmodifiable list containing the specified values, or <jk>null</jk> if the input is <jk>null</jk>.
078    */
079   @SafeVarargs
080   public static <T> List<T> alist(T...values) {  // NOSONAR
081      return values == null ? null : Arrays.asList(values);
082   }
083
084   /**
085    * Converts the specified collection to an array.
086    *
087    * @param <E> The element type.
088    * @param value The collection to convert.
089    * @param componentType The component type of the array.
090    * @return A new array.
091    */
092   public static <E> E[] array(Collection<E> value, Class<E> componentType) {
093      if (value == null)
094         return null;
095      E[] array = (E[])Array.newInstance(componentType, value.size());
096      return value.toArray(array);
097   }
098
099   /**
100    * Converts any array (including primitive arrays) to a List.
101    *
102    * @param array The array to convert. Can be any array type including primitives.
103    * @return A List containing the array elements. Primitive values are auto-boxed.
104    *         Returns null if the input is null.
105    * @throws IllegalArgumentException if the input is not an array.
106    */
107   public static List<Object> arrayToList(Object array) {
108      if (array == null) {
109         return null;  // NOSONAR
110      }
111
112      assertArg(isArray(array), "Input must be an array but was {0}", array.getClass().getName());
113
114      var componentType = array.getClass().getComponentType();
115      var length = Array.getLength(array);
116      var result = new ArrayList<>(length);
117
118      // Handle primitive arrays specifically for better performance
119      if (componentType.isPrimitive()) {
120         if (componentType == int.class) {
121            var arr = (int[]) array;
122            for (int value : arr) {
123               result.add(value);
124            }
125         } else if (componentType == long.class) {
126            var arr = (long[]) array;
127            for (long value : arr) {
128               result.add(value);
129            }
130         } else if (componentType == double.class) {
131            var arr = (double[]) array;
132            for (double value : arr) {
133               result.add(value);
134            }
135         } else if (componentType == float.class) {
136            var arr = (float[]) array;
137            for (float value : arr) {
138               result.add(value);
139            }
140         } else if (componentType == boolean.class) {
141            var arr = (boolean[]) array;
142            for (boolean value : arr) {
143               result.add(value);
144            }
145         } else if (componentType == byte.class) {
146            var arr = (byte[]) array;
147            for (byte value : arr) {
148               result.add(value);
149            }
150         } else if (componentType == char.class) {
151            var arr = (char[]) array;
152            for (char value : arr) {
153               result.add(value);
154            }
155         } else if (componentType == short.class) {
156            var arr = (short[]) array;
157            for (short value : arr) {
158               result.add(value);
159            }
160         }
161      } else {
162         // Handle Object arrays
163         for (var i = 0; i < length; i++) {
164            result.add(Array.get(array, i));
165         }
166      }
167
168      return result;
169   }
170
171   /**
172    * Throws an {@link IllegalArgumentException} if the specified expression is <jk>false</jk>.
173    *
174    * <h5 class='section'>Example:</h5>
175    * <p class='bjava'>
176    *    <jk>import static</jk> org.apache.juneau.internal.ArgUtils.*;
177    *
178    * <jk>public</jk> String setFoo(List&lt;String&gt; <jv>foo</jv>) {
179    *    <jsm>assertArg</jsm>(<jv>foo</jv> != <jk>null</jk> &amp;&amp; ! <jv>foo</jv>.isEmpty(), <js>"'foo' cannot be null or empty."</js>);
180    *    ...
181    * }
182    * </p>
183    *
184    * @param expression The boolean expression to check.
185    * @param msg The exception message.
186    * @param args The exception message args.
187    * @throws IllegalArgumentException Constructed exception.
188    */
189   public static final void assertArg(boolean expression, String msg, Object...args) throws IllegalArgumentException {
190      if (! expression)
191         throw new IllegalArgumentException(MessageFormat.format(msg, args));
192   }
193
194   /**
195    * Throws an {@link IllegalArgumentException} if the specified argument is <jk>null</jk>.
196    *
197    * <h5 class='section'>Example:</h5>
198    * <p class='bjava'>
199    *    <jk>import static</jk> org.apache.juneau.internal.ArgUtils.*;
200    *
201    * <jk>public</jk> String setFoo(String <jv>foo</jv>) {
202    *    <jsm>assertArgNotNull</jsm>(<js>"foo"</js>, <jv>foo</jv>);
203    *    ...
204    * }
205    * </p>
206    *
207    * @param <T> The argument data type.
208    * @param name The argument name.
209    * @param o The object to check.
210    * @return The same argument.
211    * @throws IllegalArgumentException Constructed exception.
212    */
213   public static final <T> T assertArgNotNull(String name, T o) throws IllegalArgumentException {
214      assertArg(o != null, "Argument ''{0}'' cannot be null.", name);
215      return o;
216   }
217
218   /**
219    * Throws an {@link IllegalArgumentException} if the specified string is <jk>null</jk> or blank.
220    *
221    * @param name The argument name.
222    * @param o The object to check.
223    * @return The same object.
224    * @throws IllegalArgumentException Thrown if the specified string is <jk>null</jk> or blank.
225    */
226   public static final String assertArgNotNullOrBlank(String name, String o) throws IllegalArgumentException {
227      assertArg(o != null, "Argument ''{0}'' cannot be null.", name);
228      assertArg(! o.isBlank(), "Argument ''{0}'' cannot be blank.", name);
229      return o;
230   }
231
232   /**
233    * Throws an {@link IllegalArgumentException} if the specified varargs array or any of its elements are <jk>null</jk>.
234    *
235    * @param <T> The element type.
236    * @param name The argument name.
237    * @param o The object to check.
238    * @return The same object.
239    * @throws IllegalArgumentException Thrown if the specified varargs array or any of its elements are <jk>null</jk>.
240    */
241   public static final <T> T[] assertVarargsNotNull(String name, T[] o) throws IllegalArgumentException {
242      assertArg(o != null, "Argument ''{0}'' cannot be null.", name);
243      for (int i = 0; i < o.length; i++)
244         assertArg(o[i] != null, "Argument ''{0}'' parameter {1} cannot be null.", name, i);
245      return o;
246   }
247
248   /**
249    * Throws an {@link IllegalArgumentException} if the specified value doesn't have all subclasses of the specified type.
250    *
251    * @param <E> The element type.
252    * @param name The argument name.
253    * @param type The expected parent class.
254    * @param value The array value being checked.
255    * @return The value cast to the specified array type.
256    * @throws IllegalArgumentException Constructed exception.
257    */
258   public static final <E> Class<E>[] assertClassArrayArgIsType(String name, Class<E> type, Class<?>[] value) throws IllegalArgumentException {
259      for (var i = 0; i < value.length; i++)
260         if (! type.isAssignableFrom(value[i]))
261            throw new IllegalArgumentException("Arg "+name+" did not have arg of type "+type.getName()+" at index "+i+": "+value[i].getName());
262      return (Class<E>[])value;
263   }
264
265   /**
266    * Casts an object to a specific type if it's an instance of that type.
267    *
268    * @param <T> The type to cast to.
269    * @param c The type to cast to.
270    * @param o The object to cast to.
271    * @return The cast object, or <jk>null</jk> if the object wasn't the specified type.
272    */
273   public static <T> T cast(Class<T> c, Object o) {
274      return o != null && c.isInstance(o) ? c.cast(o) : null;
275   }
276
277   /**
278    * If the specified object is an instance of the specified class, casts it to that type.
279    *
280    * @param <T> The class to cast to.
281    * @param o The object to cast.
282    * @param c The class to cast to.
283    * @return The cast object, or <jk>null</jk> if the object wasn't an instance of the specified class.
284    */
285   public static <T> T castOrNull(Object o, Class<T> c) {
286      if (c.isInstance(o))
287         return c.cast(o);
288      return null;
289   }
290
291   /**
292    * Compares two objects for equality.
293    *
294    * <p>
295    * Nulls are always considered less-than unless both are null.
296    *
297    * @param o1 Object 1.
298    * @param o2 Object 2.
299    * @return
300    *    <c>-1</c>, <c>0</c>, or <c>1</c> if <c>o1</c> is less-than, equal, or greater-than <c>o2</c>.
301    * <br><c>0</c> if objects are not of the same type or do not implement the {@link Comparable} interface.
302    */
303   @SuppressWarnings({ "rawtypes", "unchecked" })
304   public static int compare(Object o1, Object o2) {
305      if (o1 == null) {
306         if (o2 == null)
307            return 0;
308         return -1;
309      } else if (o2 == null) {
310         return 1;
311      }
312
313      if (o1.getClass() == o2.getClass() && o1 instanceof Comparable)
314         return ((Comparable)o1).compareTo(o2);
315
316      return 0;
317   }
318
319   /**
320    * Null-safe {@link String#contains(CharSequence)} operation.
321    *
322    * @param s The string to check.
323    * @param values The characters to check for.
324    * @return <jk>true</jk> if the string contains any of the specified characters.
325    */
326   public static boolean contains(String s, char...values) {
327      if (s == null || values == null || values.length == 0)
328         return false;
329      for (var v : values) {
330         if (s.indexOf(v) >= 0)
331            return true;
332      }
333      return false;
334   }
335
336   /**
337    * Null-safe {@link String#contains(CharSequence)} operation.
338    *
339    * @param s The string to check.
340    * @param values The substrings to check for.
341    * @return <jk>true</jk> if the string contains any of the specified substrings.
342    */
343   public static boolean contains(String s, String...values) {
344      if (s == null || values == null || values.length == 0)
345         return false;
346      for (var v : values) {
347         if (s.contains(v))
348            return true;
349      }
350      return false;
351   }
352
353   public static <T> T[] ea(Class<T> type) {
354      return (T[])Array.newInstance(type, 0);
355   }

358    * Shortcut for creating an empty list of the specified type.
359    *
360    * @param <T> The element type.
361    * @param type The element type class.
362    * @return An empty list.
363    */
364   public static <T> List<T> elist(Class<T> type) {
365      return Collections.emptyList();
366   }

368   public static <K,V> Map<K,V> emap(Class<K> keyType, Class<V> valueType) {
369      return Collections.emptyMap();
370   }

373    * Returns an empty {@link Optional}.
374    *
375    * @param <T> The component type.
376    * @return An empty {@link Optional}.
377    */
378   public static <T> Optional<T> empty() {
379      return Optional.empty();
380   }

382   /**
383    * Returns the specified string, or blank if that string is null.
384    *
385    * @param value The value to convert to a string.
386    * @return The string representation of the value, or an empty string if <jk>null</jk>.
387    */
388   public static String emptyIfNull(Object value) {
389      return value == null ? "" : value.toString();
390   }
391
392   /**
393    * Looks up a system property or environment variable.
394    *
395    * <p>
396    * First looks in system properties.  Then converts the name to env-safe and looks in the system environment.
397    * Then returns the default if it can't be found.
398    *
399    * @param name The property name.
400    * @return The value if found.
401    */
402   public static Optional<String> env(String name) {
403      var s = System.getProperty(name);
404      if (s == null)
405         s = System.getenv(envName(name));
406      return opt(s);
407   }
408
409   /**
410    * Looks up a system property or environment variable.
411    *
412    * <p>
413    * First looks in system properties.  Then converts the name to env-safe and looks in the system environment.
414    * Then returns the default if it can't be found.
415    *
416    * @param <T> The type to convert the value to.
417    * @param name The property name.
418    * @param def The default value if not found.
419    * @return The default value.
420    */
421   public static <T> T env(String name, T def) {
422      return env(name).map(x -> toType(x, def)).orElse(def);
423   }
424
425   private static String envName(String name) {
426      return PROPERTY_TO_ENV.computeIfAbsent(name, x->x.toUpperCase().replace(".", "_"));
427   }
428
429   /**
430    * Tests two strings for equality, but gracefully handles nulls.
431    *
432    * @param caseInsensitive Use case-insensitive matching.
433    * @param s1 String 1.
434    * @param s2 String 2.
435    * @return <jk>true</jk> if the strings are equal.
436    */
437   public static boolean eq(boolean caseInsensitive, String s1, String s2) {
438      return caseInsensitive ? eqic(s1, s2) : eq(s1, s2);
439   }
440
441   /**
442    * Tests two objects for equality, gracefully handling nulls and arrays.
443    *
444    * @param <T> The value types.
445    * @param o1 Object 1.
446    * @param o2 Object 2.
447    * @return <jk>true</jk> if both objects are equal based on the {@link Object#equals(Object)} method.
448    */
449   public static <T> boolean eq(T o1, T o2) {
450      if (isArray(o1) && isArray(o2)) {
451         int l1 = Array.getLength(o1), l2 = Array.getLength(o2);
452         if (l1 != l2)
453            return false;
454         for (int i = 0; i < l1; i++)
455            if (! eq(Array.get(o1, i), Array.get(o2, i)))
456               return false;
457         return true;
458      }
459      return Objects.equals(o1, o2);
460   }
461
462   /**
463    * Tests two objects for equality, gracefully handling nulls.
464    *
465    * Allows you to simplify object comparison without sacrificing efficiency.
466    *
467    * Example:
468    * <code>
469    *    public boolean equals(Object o)
470    *       return eq(this, (Role)o, (x,y)-&gt;eq(x.id,y.id) &amp;&amp; eq(x.name,y.name) &amp;&amp; eq(x.created,y.created) &amp;&amp; eq(x.createdBy,y.createdBy));
471    *    }
472    * </code>
473    *
474    * @param <T> Object 1 type.
475    * @param <U> Object 2 type.
476    * @param o1 Object 1.
477    * @param o2 Object 2.
478    * @param test The test to use for equality.
479    * @return <jk>true</jk> if both objects are equal based on the test.
480    */
481   public static <T,U> boolean eq(T o1, U o2, BiPredicate<T,U> test) {
482      if (o1 == null) { return o2 == null; }
483      if (o2 == null) { return false; }
484      if (o1 == o2) { return true; }
485      return test.test(o1, o2);
486   }
487
488   /**
489    * Tests two strings for case-insensitive equality, but gracefully handles nulls.
490    *
491    * @param s1 String 1.
492    * @param s2 String 2.
493    * @return <jk>true</jk> if the strings are equal.
494    */
495   public static boolean eqic(String s1, String s2) {
496      if (s1 == null)
497         return s2 == null;
498      if (s2 == null)
499         return false;
500      return s1.equalsIgnoreCase(s2);
501   }
502
503   /**
504    * Same as MessageFormat.format().
505    *
506    * @param pattern The message pattern.
507    * @param args The arguments to substitute into the pattern.
508    * @return The formatted string.
509    */
510   public static String f(String pattern, Object...args) {
511      if (args.length == 0)
512         return pattern;
513      return MessageFormat.format(pattern, args);
514   }
515
516   /**
517    * Returns the first non-null value in the specified array
518    *
519    * @param <T> The value types.
520    * @param t The values to check.
521    * @return The first non-null value, or <jk>null</jk> if the array is null or empty or contains only <jk>null</jk> values.
522    */
523   @SafeVarargs
524   public static <T> T firstNonNull(T... t) {
525      if (t != null)
526         for (T tt : t)
527            if (tt != null)
528               return tt;
529      return null;
530   }
531
532   /**
533    * Creates a formatted string supplier with message arguments for lazy evaluation.
534    *
535    * <p>This method returns a {@link Supplier} that formats the string pattern with the provided arguments
536    * only when the supplier's {@code get()} method is called. This is useful for expensive string formatting
537    * operations that may not always be needed, such as error messages in assertions.</p>
538    *
539    * <h5 class='section'>Usage Examples:</h5>
540    * <p class='bjava'>
541    *    <jc>// Lazy evaluation - string is only formatted if assertion fails</jc>
542    *    assertTrue(condition, fms(<js>"Expected {0} but got {1}"</js>, expected, actual));
543    *
544    *    <jc>// Can be used anywhere a Supplier&lt;String&gt; is expected</jc>
545    *    Supplier&lt;String&gt; <jv>messageSupplier</jv> = fms(<js>"Processing item {0} of {1}"</js>, i, total);
546    * </p>
547    *
548    * @param pattern The message pattern using <js>{0}</js>, <js>{1}</js>, etc. placeholders.
549    * @param args The arguments to substitute into the pattern placeholders.
550    * @return A {@link Supplier} that will format the string when {@code get()} is called.
551    * @see StringUtils#format(String, Object...)
552    */
553   public static Supplier<String> fms(String pattern, Object...args) {
554      return ()->StringUtils.format(pattern, args);
555   }
556
557   /**
558    * Converts a string containing <js>"*"</js> meta characters with a regular expression pattern.
559    *
560    * @param s The string to create a pattern from.
561    * @return A regular expression pattern.
562    */
563   public static Pattern getMatchPattern3(String s) {
564      return getMatchPattern3(s, 0);
565   }
566
567   /**
568    * Converts a string containing <js>"*"</js> meta characters with a regular expression pattern.
569    *
570    * @param s The string to create a pattern from.
571    * @param flags Regular expression flags.
572    * @return A regular expression pattern.
573    */
574   public static Pattern getMatchPattern3(String s, int flags) {
575      if (s == null)
576         return null;
577      var sb = new StringBuilder();
578      sb.append("\\Q");
579      for (var i = 0; i < s.length(); i++) {
580         var c = s.charAt(i);
581         if (c == '*')
582            sb.append("\\E").append(".*").append("\\Q");
583         else if (c == '?')
584            sb.append("\\E").append(".").append("\\Q");
585         else
586            sb.append(c);
587      }
588      sb.append("\\E");
589      return Pattern.compile(sb.toString(), flags);
590   }

592   /**
593    * Shortcut for calling {@link Objects#hash(Object...)}.
594    *
595    * @param values The values to hash.
596    * @return A hash code value for the given values.
597    */
598   public static final int hash(Object...values) {
599      return Objects.hash(values);
600   }
601
602   /**
603    * Creates an {@link IllegalArgumentException}.
604    *
605    * @param msg The exception message.
606    * @param args The arguments to substitute into the message.
607    * @return A new IllegalArgumentException with the formatted message.
608    */
609   public static IllegalArgumentException illegalArg(String msg, Object...args) {
610      return new IllegalArgumentException(args.length == 0 ? msg : f(msg, args));
611   }
612
613   public static boolean isArray(Object o) {
614      return o != null && o.getClass().isArray();
615   }
616
617   /**
618    * Returns <jk>true</jk> if the specified object is empty.
619    *
620    * <p>
621    * Return <jk>true</jk> if the value is any of the following:
622    * <ul>
623    *    <li><jk>null</jk>
624    *    <li>An empty Collection
625    *    <li>An empty Map
626    *    <li>An empty array
627    *    <li>An empty CharSequence
628    *    <li>An empty String when serialized to a string using {@link Object#toString()}.
629    * </ul>
630    *
631    * @param o The object to test.
632    * @return <jk>true</jk> if the specified object is empty.
633    */
634   public static boolean isEmpty(Object o) {
635      if (o == null)
636         return true;
637      if (o instanceof Collection<?> o2)
638         return  o2.isEmpty();
639      if (o instanceof Map<?,?> o2)
640         return o2.isEmpty();
641      if (isArray(o))
642         return (Array.getLength(o) == 0);
643      return o.toString().isEmpty();
644   }
645
646   /**
647    * Returns <jk>true</jk> if string is <jk>null</jk> or empty.
648    *
649    * @param o The string to check.
650    * @return <jk>true</jk> if string is <jk>null</jk> or empty.
651    */
652   public static boolean isEmpty(String o) {
653      return o == null || o.isEmpty();
654   }
655
656   /**
657    * Returns <jk>true</jk> if specified string is <jk>null</jk> or empty or consists of only blanks.
658    *
659    * @param s The string to check.
660    * @return <jk>true</jk> if specified string is <jk>null</jk> or emptyor consists of only blanks.
661    */
662   public static boolean isEmptyOrBlank(String s) {
663      return s == null || s.trim().isEmpty();
664   }
665
666   /**
667    * Returns <jk>true</jk> if the specified object is not <jk>null</jk> and not empty.
668    *
669    * Works on any of the following data types:  String, CharSequence, Collection, Map, array.
670    * All other types are stringified and then checked as a String.
671    *
672    * @param value The value being checked.
673    * @return <jk>true</jk> if the specified object is not <jk>null</jk> and not empty.
674    */
675   public static boolean isNotEmpty(Object value) {
676      if (value == null) return false;
677      if (value instanceof CharSequence x) return ! x.isEmpty();
678      if (value instanceof Collection<?> x) return ! x.isEmpty();
679      if (value instanceof Map<?,?> x) return ! x.isEmpty();
680      if (isArray(value)) return Array.getLength(value) > 0;
681      return isNotEmpty(s(value));
682   }
683
684   /**
685    * Returns <jk>true</jk> if string is not <jk>null</jk> and not empty.
686    *
687    * @param o The string to check.
688    * @return <jk>true</jk> if string is not <jk>null</jk> and not empty.
689    */
690   public static boolean isNotEmpty(String o) {
691      return ! isEmpty(o);
692   }
693
694   /**
695    * Returns <jk>true</jk> if the specified number is not <jk>null</jk> and not <c>-1</c>.
696    *
697    * @param <T> The value types.
698    * @param value The value being checked.
699    * @return <jk>true</jk> if the specified number is not <jk>null</jk> and not <c>-1</c>.
700    */
701   public static <T extends Number> boolean isNotMinusOne(T value) {
702      return value != null && value.intValue() != -1;
703   }
704
705   /**
706    * Returns <jk>true</jk> if the specified object is not <jk>null</jk>.
707    *
708    * @param <T> The value type.
709    * @param value The value being checked.
710    * @return <jk>true</jk> if the specified object is not <jk>null</jk>.
711    */
712   public static <T> boolean isNotNull(T value) {
713      return value != null;
714   }
715
716   /**
717    * Returns <jk>true</jk> if the specified boolean is not <jk>null</jk> and is <jk>true</jk>.
718    *
719    * @param value The value being checked.
720    * @return <jk>true</jk> if the specified boolean is not <jk>null</jk> and is <jk>true</jk>.
721    */
722   public static boolean isTrue(Boolean value) {
723      return value != null && value;
724   }
725
726   /**
727    * Join the specified tokens into a delimited string.
728    *
729    * @param tokens The tokens to join.
730    * @param d The delimiter.
731    * @return The delimited string.  If <c>tokens</c> is <jk>null</jk>, returns <jk>null</jk>.
732    */
733   public static String join(Collection<?> tokens, char d) {
734      if (tokens == null)
735         return null;
736      var sb = new StringBuilder();
737      for (var iter = tokens.iterator(); iter.hasNext();) {
738         sb.append(iter.next());
739         if (iter.hasNext())
740            sb.append(d);
741      }
742      return sb.toString();
743   }
744
745   /**
746    * Join the specified tokens into a delimited string.
747    *
748    * @param tokens The tokens to join.
749    * @param d The delimiter.
750    * @return The delimited string.  If <c>tokens</c> is <jk>null</jk>, returns <jk>null</jk>.
751    */
752   public static String join(Collection<?> tokens, String d) {
753      if (tokens == null)
754         return null;
755      return join(tokens, d, new StringBuilder()).toString();
756   }
757
758   /**
759    * Joins the specified tokens into a delimited string and writes the output to the specified string builder.
760    *
761    * @param tokens The tokens to join.
762    * @param d The delimiter.
763    * @param sb The string builder to append the response to.
764    * @return The same string builder passed in as <c>sb</c>.
765    */
766   public static StringBuilder join(Collection<?> tokens, String d, StringBuilder sb) {
767      if (tokens == null)
768         return sb;
769      for (var iter = tokens.iterator(); iter.hasNext();) {
770         sb.append(iter.next());
771         if (iter.hasNext())
772            sb.append(d);
773      }
774      return sb;
775   }
776
777   /**
778    * Join the specified tokens into a delimited string.
779    *
780    * @param tokens The tokens to join.
781    * @param d The delimiter.
782    * @return The delimited string.  If <c>tokens</c> is <jk>null</jk>, returns <jk>null</jk>.
783    */
784   public static String join(int[] tokens, char d) {
785      if (tokens == null)
786         return null;
787      var sb = new StringBuilder();
788      for (var i = 0; i < tokens.length; i++) {
789         if (i > 0)
790            sb.append(d);
791         sb.append(tokens[i]);
792      }
793      return sb.toString();
794   }
795
796   /**
797    * Join the specified tokens into a delimited string.
798    *
799    * @param tokens The tokens to join.
800    * @param d The delimiter.
801    * @return The delimited string.  If <c>tokens</c> is <jk>null</jk>, returns <jk>null</jk>.
802    */
803   public static String join(List<?> tokens, char d) {
804      if (tokens == null)
805         return null;
806      var sb = new StringBuilder();
807      for (int i = 0, j = tokens.size(); i < j; i++) {
808         if (i > 0)
809            sb.append(d);
810         sb.append(tokens.get(i));
811      }
812      return sb.toString();
813   }
814
815   /**
816    * Join the specified tokens into a delimited string.
817    *
818    * @param tokens The tokens to join.
819    * @param d The delimiter.
820    * @return The delimited string.  If <c>tokens</c> is <jk>null</jk>, returns <jk>null</jk>.
821    */
822   public static String join(List<?> tokens, String d) {
823      if (tokens == null)
824         return null;
825      return join(tokens, d, new StringBuilder()).toString();
826   }

828   /**
829    * Joins the specified tokens into a delimited string and writes the output to the specified string builder.
830    *
831    * @param tokens The tokens to join.
832    * @param d The delimiter.
833    * @param sb The string builder to append the response to.
834    * @return The same string builder passed in as <c>sb</c>.
835    */
836   public static StringBuilder join(List<?> tokens, String d, StringBuilder sb) {
837      if (tokens == null)
838         return sb;
839      for (int i = 0, j = tokens.size(); i < j; i++) {
840         if (i > 0)
841            sb.append(d);
842         sb.append(tokens.get(i));
843      }
844      return sb;
845   }
846
847   /**
848    * Joins the specified tokens into a delimited string.
849    *
850    * @param tokens The tokens to join.
851    * @param d The delimiter.
852    * @return The delimited string.  If <c>tokens</c> is <jk>null</jk>, returns <jk>null</jk>.
853    */
854   public static String join(Object[] tokens, char d) {
855      if (tokens == null)
856         return null;
857      if (tokens.length == 1)
858         return emptyIfNull(s(tokens[0]));
859      return join(tokens, d, new StringBuilder()).toString();
860   }
861
862   /**
863    * Join the specified tokens into a delimited string and writes the output to the specified string builder.
864    *
865    * @param tokens The tokens to join.
866    * @param d The delimiter.
867    * @param sb The string builder to append the response to.
868    * @return The same string builder passed in as <c>sb</c>.
869    */
870   public static StringBuilder join(Object[] tokens, char d, StringBuilder sb) {
871      if (tokens == null)
872         return sb;
873      for (var i = 0; i < tokens.length; i++) {
874         if (i > 0)
875            sb.append(d);
876         sb.append(tokens[i]);
877      }
878      return sb;

881   /**
882    * Join the specified tokens into a delimited string.
883    *
884    * @param tokens The tokens to join.
885    * @param separator The delimiter.
886    * @return The delimited string.  If <c>tokens</c> is <jk>null</jk>, returns <jk>null</jk>.
887    */
888   public static String join(Object[] tokens, String separator) {
889      if (tokens == null)
890         return null;
891      var sb = new StringBuilder();
892      for (var i = 0; i < tokens.length; i++) {
893         if (i > 0)
894            sb.append(separator);
895         sb.append(tokens[i]);
896      }
897      return sb.toString();
898   }

906   public static String joinnl(Object[] tokens) {

914    * @param values The values to add to the list.
915    * @return A modifiable list containing the specified values.
916    */
917   @SafeVarargs
918   public static <T> List<T> list(T...values) {  // NOSONAR
919      return new ArrayList<>(Arrays.asList(values));

927    * @return A new modifiable list.

929   public static <E> ArrayList<E> listOfSize(int size) {

933   /**
934    * Shortcut for creating a modifiable map out of an array of key-value pairs.
935    *
936    * @param <K> The key type.
937    * @param <V> The value type.
938    * @param values The key-value pairs (alternating keys and values).
939    * @return A modifiable LinkedHashMap containing the specified key-value pairs.
940    */
941   @SafeVarargs
942   public static <K,V> LinkedHashMap<K,V> map(Object...values) {  // NOSONAR
943      var m = new LinkedHashMap<K,V>();
944      for (var i = 0; i < values.length; i+=2) {
945         m.put((K)values[i], (V)values[i+1]);
946      }
947      return m;
948   }

958   /**
959    * Null-safe not-equals check.
960    *
961    * @param <T> The object type.
962    * @param s1 Object 1.
963    * @param s2 Object 2.
964    * @return <jk>true</jk> if the objects are not equal.
965    */
966   public static <T> boolean ne(T s1, T s2) {
967      return ! eq(s1, s2);
968   }
969
970   /**
971    * Tests two objects for inequality, gracefully handling nulls.
972    *
973    * @param <T> Object 1 type.
974    * @param <U> Object 2 type.
975    * @param o1 Object 1.
976    * @param o2 Object 2.
977    * @param test The test to use for equality.
978    * @return <jk>false</jk> if both objects are equal based on the test.
979    */
980   public static <T,U> boolean ne(T o1, U o2, BiPredicate<T,U> test) {
981      if (o1 == null)
982         return o2 != null;
983      if (o2 == null)
984         return true;
985      if (o1 == o2)
986         return false;
987      return ! test.test(o1, o2);
988   }
989
990   /**
991    * Tests two strings for non-equality ignoring case, but gracefully handles nulls.
992    *
993    * @param s1 String 1.
994    * @param s2 String 2.
995    * @return <jk>true</jk> if the strings are not equal ignoring case.
996    */
997   public static boolean neic(String s1, String s2) {
998      return ! eqic(s1, s2);
999   }

1050    * @return <jk>null</jk> if the specified string is <jk>null</jk> or empty, or the same string if not.
1051    */
1052   public static String nullIfEmpty3(String s) {
1053      if (s == null || s.isEmpty())
1054         return null;
1055      return s;
1056   }

1058   /**
1059    * Returns an obfuscated version of the specified string.
1060    *
1061    * @param s The string to obfuscate.
1062    * @return The obfuscated string with most characters replaced by asterisks.
1063    */
1064   public static String obfuscate(String s) {
1065      if (s == null || s.length() < 2)
1066         return "*";
1067      return s.substring(0, 1) + s.substring(1).replaceAll(".", "*");  // NOSONAR
1068   }

1097      for (var i = 0; i < lines.length; i++)
1098         System.out.println(String.format("%4s:" + lines[i], i+1)); // NOSONAR - NOT DEBUG
1099   }

1101   /**
1102    * Converts an arbitrary object to a readable string format suitable for debugging and testing.
1103    *
1104    * <p>This method provides intelligent formatting for various Java types, recursively processing
1105    * nested structures to create human-readable representations. It's extensively used throughout
1106    * the Juneau framework for test assertions and debugging output.</p>
1107    *
1108     * <h5 class='section'>Type-Specific Formatting:</h5>
1109    * <ul>
1110    *    <li><b>null:</b> Returns <js>null</js></li>
1111    *    <li><b>Optional:</b> Recursively formats the contained value (or <js>null</js> if empty)</li>
1112    *    <li><b>Collections:</b> Formats as <js>"[item1,item2,item3]"</js> with comma-separated elements</li>
1113    *    <li><b>Maps:</b> Formats as <js>"{key1=value1,key2=value2}"</js> with comma-separated entries</li>
1114    *    <li><b>Map.Entry:</b> Formats as <js>"key=value"</js></li>
1115    *    <li><b>Arrays:</b> Converts to list format <js>"[item1,item2,item3]"</js></li>
1116    *    <li><b>Iterables/Iterators/Enumerations:</b> Converts to list and formats recursively</li>
1117    *    <li><b>GregorianCalendar:</b> Formats as ISO instant timestamp</li>
1118    *    <li><b>Date:</b> Formats as ISO instant string (e.g., <js>"2023-12-25T10:30:00Z"</js>)</li>
1119    *    <li><b>InputStream:</b> Converts to hexadecimal representation</li>
1120    *    <li><b>Reader:</b> Reads content and returns as string</li>
1121    *    <li><b>File:</b> Reads file content and returns as string</li>
1122    *    <li><b>byte[]:</b> Converts to hexadecimal representation</li>
1123    *    <li><b>Enum:</b> Returns the enum name via {@link Enum#name()}</li>
1124    *    <li><b>All other types:</b> Uses {@link Object#toString()}</li>
1125    * </ul>
1126    *
1127    * <h5 class='section'>Examples:</h5>
1128    * <p class='bjava'>
1129    *    <jc>// Collections</jc>
1130    *    r(List.of("a", "b", "c")) <jc>// Returns: "[a,b,c]"</jc>
1131    *    r(Set.of(1, 2, 3)) <jc>// Returns: "[1,2,3]" (order may vary)</jc>
1132    *
1133    *    <jc>// Maps</jc>
1134    *    r(Map.of("foo", "bar", "baz", 123)) <jc>// Returns: "{foo=bar,baz=123}"</jc>
1135    *
1136    *    <jc>// Arrays</jc>
1137    *    r(new int[]{1, 2, 3}) <jc>// Returns: "[1,2,3]"</jc>
1138    *    r(new String[]{"a", "b"}) <jc>// Returns: "[a,b]"</jc>
1139    *
1140    *    <jc>// Nested structures</jc>
1141    *    r(List.of(Map.of("x", 1), Set.of("a", "b"))) <jc>// Returns: "[{x=1},[a,b]]"</jc>
1142    *
1143     *   <jc>// Special types</jc>
1144    *    r(Optional.of("test")) <jc>// Returns: "test"</jc>
1145    *    r(Optional.empty()) <jc>// Returns: null</jc>
1146    *    r(new Date(1640995200000L)) <jc>// Returns: "2022-01-01T00:00:00Z"</jc>
1147    *    r(MyEnum.FOO) <jc>// Returns: "FOO"</jc>
1148    * </p>
1149    *
1150    * <h5 class='section'>Recursive Processing:</h5>
1151    * <p>The method recursively processes nested structures, so complex objects containing
1152    * collections, maps, and arrays are fully flattened into readable format. This makes it
1153    * ideal for test assertions where you need to compare complex object structures.</p>
1154    *
1155    * <h5 class='section'>Error Handling:</h5>
1156    * <p>IO operations (reading files, streams) are wrapped in safe() calls, converting
1157    * any exceptions to RuntimeExceptions. Binary data (InputStreams, byte arrays) is
1158    * converted to hexadecimal representation for readability.</p>
1159    *
1160    * @param o The object to convert to readable format. Can be <jk>null</jk>.
1161    * @return A readable string representation of the object, or <jk>null</jk> if the input was <jk>null</jk>.
1162    * @see #safe(ThrowingSupplier)
1163    */
1164   public static String r(Object o) {
1165      if (o == null)
1166         return null;
1167      if (o instanceof Optional<?> o2)
1168         return r(o2.orElse(null));
1169      if (o instanceof Collection<?> o2)
1170         return o2.stream().map(Utils::r).collect(joining(",","[","]"));
1171      if (o instanceof Map<?,?> o2)
1172         return o2.entrySet().stream().map(Utils::r).collect(joining(",","{","}"));
1173      if (o instanceof Map.Entry<?,?> o2)
1174         return r(o2.getKey()) + '=' + r(o2.getValue());
1175      if (o instanceof Iterable<?> o2)
1176         return r(toList(o2));
1177      if (o instanceof Iterator<?> o2)
1178         return r(toList(o2));
1179      if (o instanceof Enumeration<?> o2)
1180         return r(toList(o2));
1181      if (o instanceof GregorianCalendar o2)
1182         return o2.toZonedDateTime().format(DateTimeFormatter.ISO_INSTANT);
1183      if (o instanceof Date o2)
1184         return o2.toInstant().toString();
1185      if (o instanceof InputStream o2)
1186         return toHex(o2);
1187      if (o instanceof Reader o2)
1188         return safe(()->IOUtils.read(o2));
1189      if (o instanceof File o2)
1190         return safe(()->IOUtils.read(o2));
1191      if (o instanceof byte[] o2)
1192         return toHex(o2);
1193      if (o instanceof Enum o2)
1194         return o2.name();
1195      if (o instanceof Class o2)
1196         return o2.getSimpleName();
1197      if (o instanceof Executable o2) {
1198         var sb = new StringBuilder(64);
1199         sb.append(o2 instanceof Constructor ? o2.getDeclaringClass().getSimpleName() : o2.getName()).append('(');
1200         Class<?>[] pt = o2.getParameterTypes();
1201         for (int i = 0; i < pt.length; i++) {
1202            if (i > 0)
1203               sb.append(',');
1204            sb.append(pt[i].getSimpleName());
1205         }
1206         sb.append(')');
1207         return sb.toString();
1208      }
1209      if (isArray(o)) {
1210         var l = list();
1211         for (var i = 0; i < Array.getLength(o); i++) {
1212            l.add(Array.get(o, i));
1213         }
1214         return r(l);
1215      }
1216      return o.toString();
1217   }
1218
1219   /**
1220    * Creates a {@link RuntimeException}.
1221    *
1222    * @param msg The exception message.
1223    * @param args The arguments to substitute into the message.
1224    * @return A new RuntimeException with the formatted message.
1225    */
1226   public static RuntimeException runtimeException(String msg, Object...args) {
1227      return new RuntimeException(args.length == 0 ? msg : f(msg, args));
1228   }

1230   /**
1231    * Shortcut for converting an object to a string.
1232    *
1233    * @param val The object to convert.
1234    * @return The string representation of the object, or <jk>null</jk> if the object is <jk>null</jk>.
1235    */
1236   public static String s(Object val) {
1237      return val == null ? null : val.toString();
1238   }
1239
1240   /**
1241    * Runs a snippet of code and encapsulates any throwable inside a {@link RuntimeException}.
1242    *
1243    * @param snippet The snippet of code to run.
1244    */
1245   public static void safe(Snippet snippet) {
1246      try {
1247         snippet.run();
1248      } catch (RuntimeException t) {
1249         throw t;
1250      } catch (Throwable t) {
1251         throw ThrowableUtils.asRuntimeException(t);
1252      }
1253   }
1254
1255   /**
1256    * Used to wrap code that returns a value but throws an exception.
1257    * Useful in cases where you're trying to execute code in a fluent method call
1258    * or are trying to eliminate untestable catch blocks in code.
1259    *
1260    * @param <T> The return type.
1261    * @param s The supplier that may throw an exception.
1262    * @return The result of the supplier execution.
1263    */
1264   public static <T> T safe(ThrowingSupplier<T> s) {
1265      try {
1266         return s.get();
1267      } catch (RuntimeException e) {
1268         throw e;
1269      } catch (Exception e) {
1270         throw new RuntimeException(e);
1271      }
1272   }
1273
1274   /**
1275    * Allows you to wrap a supplier that throws an exception so that it can be used in a fluent interface.
1276    *
1277    * @param <T> The supplier type.
1278    * @param supplier The supplier throwing an exception.
1279    * @return The supplied result.
1280    * @throws RuntimeException if supplier threw an exception.
1281    */
1282   public static <T> T safeSupplier(ThrowableUtils.SupplierWithThrowable<T> supplier) {
1283      try {
1284         return supplier.get();
1285      } catch (RuntimeException t) {
1286         throw t;
1287      } catch (Throwable t) {
1288         throw ThrowableUtils.asRuntimeException(t);
1289      }
1290   }
1291
1292   /**
1293    * Shortcut for creating a modifiable set out of an array of values.
1294    *
1295    * @param <T> The element type.
1296    * @param values The values to add to the set.
1297    * @return A modifiable LinkedHashSet containing the specified values.
1298    */
1299   @SafeVarargs
1300   public static <T> LinkedHashSet<T> set(T...values) {  // NOSONAR
1301      return new LinkedHashSet<>(Arrays.asList(values));
1302   }
1303
1304   /**
1305    * Splits a comma-delimited list into a list of strings.
1306    *
1307    * @param s The string to split.
1308    * @return A list of split strings, or an empty list if the input is <jk>null</jk>.
1309    */
1310   public static List<String> split(String s) {
1311      return s == null ? Collections.emptyList() : split(s, ',');
1312   }
1313
1314   /**
1315    * Splits a character-delimited string into a string array.
1316    *
1317    * <p>
1318    * Does not split on escaped-delimiters (e.g. "\,");
1319    * Resulting tokens are trimmed of whitespace.
1320    *
1321    * <p>
1322    * <b>NOTE:</b>  This behavior is different than the Jakarta equivalent.
1323    * split("a,b,c",',') -&gt; {"a","b","c"}
1324    * split("a, b ,c ",',') -&gt; {"a","b","c"}
1325    * split("a,,c",',') -&gt; {"a","","c"}
1326    * split(",,",',') -&gt; {"","",""}
1327    * split("",',') -&gt; {}
1328    * split(null,',') -&gt; null
1329    * split("a,b\,c,d", ',', false) -&gt; {"a","b\,c","d"}
1330    * split("a,b\\,c,d", ',', false) -&gt; {"a","b\","c","d"}
1331    * split("a,b\,c,d", ',', true) -&gt; {"a","b,c","d"}
1332    *
1333    * @param s The string to split.  Can be <jk>null</jk>.
1334    * @param c The character to split on.
1335    * @return The tokens, or <jk>null</jk> if the string was null.
1336    */
1337   public static List<String> split(String s, char c) {
1338      return split(s, c, Integer.MAX_VALUE);
1339   }
1340
1341   /**
1342    * Same as {@link #splita(String,char)} but consumes the tokens instead of creating an array.
1343    *
1344    * @param s The string to split.
1345    * @param c The character to split on.
1346    * @param consumer The consumer of the tokens.
1347    */
1348   public static void split(String s, char c, Consumer<String> consumer) {
1349      var escapeChars = StringUtils.getEscapeSet(c);
1350
1351      if (isEmpty(s))
1352         return;
1353      if (s.indexOf(c) == -1) {
1354         consumer.accept(s);
1355         return;
1356      }
1357
1358      var x1 = 0;
1359      var escapeCount = 0;
1360
1361      for (var i = 0; i < s.length(); i++) {
1362         if (s.charAt(i) == '\\')
1363            escapeCount++;
1364         else if (s.charAt(i)==c && escapeCount % 2 == 0) {
1365            var s2 = s.substring(x1, i);
1366            var s3 = StringUtils.unEscapeChars(s2, escapeChars);
1367            consumer.accept(s3.trim());  // NOSONAR - NPE not possible.
1368            x1 = i+1;
1369         }
1370         if (s.charAt(i) != '\\')
1371            escapeCount = 0;
1372      }
1373      var s2 = s.substring(x1);
1374      var s3 = StringUtils.unEscapeChars(s2, escapeChars);
1375      consumer.accept(s3.trim());  // NOSONAR - NPE not possible.
1376   }
1377
1378   /**
1379    * Same as {@link #splita(String, char)} but limits the number of tokens returned.
1380    *
1381    * @param s The string to split.  Can be <jk>null</jk>.
1382    * @param c The character to split on.
1383    * @param limit The maximum number of tokens to return.
1384    * @return The tokens, or <jk>null</jk> if the string was null.
1385    */
1386   public static List<String> split(String s, char c, int limit) {
1387
1388      var escapeChars = StringUtils.getEscapeSet(c);
1389
1390      if (s == null)
1391         return null;  // NOSONAR - Intentional.
1392      if (isEmpty(s))
1393         return Collections.emptyList();
1394      if (s.indexOf(c) == -1)
1395         return Collections.singletonList(s);
1396
1397      var l = new LinkedList<String>();
1398      var sArray = s.toCharArray();
1399      var x1 = 0;
1400      var escapeCount = 0;
1401      limit--;
1402      for (var i = 0; i < sArray.length && limit > 0; i++) {
1403         if (sArray[i] == '\\')
1404            escapeCount++;
1405         else if (sArray[i]==c && escapeCount % 2 == 0) {
1406            var s2 = new String(sArray, x1, i-x1);
1407            var s3 = StringUtils.unEscapeChars(s2, escapeChars);
1408            l.add(s3.trim());
1409            limit--;
1410            x1 = i+1;
1411         }
1412         if (sArray[i] != '\\')
1413            escapeCount = 0;
1414      }
1415      var s2 = new String(sArray, x1, sArray.length-x1);
1416      var s3 = StringUtils.unEscapeChars(s2, escapeChars);
1417      l.add(s3.trim());
1418
1419      return l;
1420   }
1421
1422   /**
1423    * Same as {@link #splita(String)} but consumes the tokens instead of creating an array.
1424    *
1425    * @param s The string to split.
1426    * @param consumer The consumer of the tokens.
1427    */
1428   public static void split(String s, Consumer<String> consumer) {
1429      split(s, ',', consumer);
1430   }
1431
1432   /**
1433    * Splits a comma-delimited list into an array of strings.
1434    *
1435    * @param s The string to split.
1436    * @return An array of split strings.
1437    */
1438   public static String[] splita(String s) {
1439      return splita(s, ',');
1440   }
1441
1442   /**
1443    * Splits a character-delimited string into a string array.
1444    *
1445    * <p>
1446    * Does not split on escaped-delimiters (e.g. "\,");
1447    * Resulting tokens are trimmed of whitespace.
1448    *
1449    * <p>
1450    * <b>NOTE:</b>  This behavior is different than the Jakarta equivalent.
1451    * split("a,b,c",',') -&gt; {"a","b","c"}
1452    * split("a, b ,c ",',') -&gt; {"a","b","c"}
1453    * split("a,,c",',') -&gt; {"a","","c"}
1454    * split(",,",',') -&gt; {"","",""}
1455    * split("",',') -&gt; {}
1456    * split(null,',') -&gt; null
1457    * split("a,b\,c,d", ',', false) -&gt; {"a","b\,c","d"}
1458    * split("a,b\\,c,d", ',', false) -&gt; {"a","b\","c","d"}
1459    * split("a,b\,c,d", ',', true) -&gt; {"a","b,c","d"}
1460    *
1461    * @param s The string to split.  Can be <jk>null</jk>.
1462    * @param c The character to split on.
1463    * @return The tokens, or <jk>null</jk> if the string was null.
1464    */
1465   public static String[] splita(String s, char c) {
1466      return splita(s, c, Integer.MAX_VALUE);
1467   }
1468
1469   /**
1470    * Same as {@link #splita(String, char)} but limits the number of tokens returned.
1471    *
1472    * @param s The string to split.  Can be <jk>null</jk>.
1473    * @param c The character to split on.
1474    * @param limit The maximum number of tokens to return.
1475    * @return The tokens, or <jk>null</jk> if the string was null.
1476    */
1477   public static String[] splita(String s, char c, int limit) {
1478      var l = split(s, c, limit);
1479      return l == null ? null : l.toArray(new String[l.size()]);
1480   }
1481
1482   /**
1483    * Same as {@link #splita(String, char)} except splits all strings in the input and returns a single result.
1484    *
1485    * @param s The string to split.  Can be <jk>null</jk>.
1486    * @param c The character to split on.
1487    * @return The tokens, or null if the input array was null
1488    */
1489   public static String[] splita(String[] s, char c) {
1490      if (s == null)
1491         return null;  // NOSONAR - Intentional.
1492      var l = new LinkedList<String>();
1493      for (var ss : s) {
1494         if (ss == null || ss.indexOf(c) == -1)
1495            l.add(ss);
1496         else
1497            Collections.addAll(l, splita(ss, c));
1498      }
1499      return l.toArray(new String[l.size()]);
1500   }
1501
1502   /**
1503    * Splits a list of key-value pairs into an ordered map.
1504    *
1505    * <p>
1506    * Example:
1507    * <p class='bjava'>
1508    *    String <jv>in</jv> = <js>"foo=1;bar=2"</js>;
1509    *    Map <jv>map</jv> = StringUtils.<jsm>splitMap</jsm>(in, <js>';'</js>, <js>'='</js>, <jk>true</jk>);
1510    * </p>
1511    *
1512    * @param s The string to split.
1513    * @param trim Trim strings after parsing.
1514    * @return The parsed map, or null if the string was null.
1515    */
1516   public static Map<String,String> splitMap(String s, boolean trim) {
1517
1518      if (s == null)
1519         return null;  // NOSONAR - Intentional.
1520      if (isEmpty(s))
1521         return Collections.emptyMap();
1522
1523      var m = new LinkedHashMap<String,String>();
1524
1525      final int
1526         S1 = 1,  // Found start of key, looking for equals.
1527         S2 = 2;  // Found equals, looking for delimiter (or end).
1528
1529      var state = S1;
1530
1531      var sArray = s.toCharArray();
1532      var x1 = 0;
1533      var escapeCount = 0;
1534      String key = null;
1535      for (var i = 0; i < sArray.length + 1; i++) {
1536         var c = i == sArray.length ? ',' : sArray[i];
1537         if (c == '\\')
1538            escapeCount++;
1539         if (escapeCount % 2 == 0) {
1540            if (state == S1) {
1541               if (c == '=') {
1542                  key = s.substring(x1, i);
1543                  if (trim)
1544                     key = StringUtils.trim(key);
1545                  key = StringUtils.unEscapeChars(key, StringUtils.MAP_ESCAPE_SET);
1546                  state = S2;
1547                  x1 = i+1;
1548               } else if (c == ',') {
1549                  key = s.substring(x1, i);
1550                  if (trim)
1551                     key = StringUtils.trim(key);
1552                  key = StringUtils.unEscapeChars(key, StringUtils.MAP_ESCAPE_SET);
1553                  m.put(key, "");
1554                  state = S1;
1555                  x1 = i+1;
1556               }
1557            } else if (state == S2) {
1558               if (c == ',') {  // NOSONAR - Intentional.
1559                  var val = s.substring(x1, i);
1560                  if (trim)
1561                     val = StringUtils.trim(val);
1562                  val = StringUtils.unEscapeChars(val, StringUtils.MAP_ESCAPE_SET);
1563                  m.put(key, val);
1564                  key = null;
1565                  x1 = i+1;
1566                  state = S1;
1567               }
1568            }
1569         }
1570         if (c != '\\')
1571            escapeCount = 0;
1572      }
1573
1574      return m;
1575   }
1576
1577   /**
1578    * Splits the method arguments in the signature of a method.
1579    *
1580    * @param s The arguments to split.
1581    * @return The split arguments, or null if the input string is null.
1582    */
1583   public static String[] splitMethodArgs(String s) {
1584
1585      if (s == null)
1586         return null;  // NOSONAR - Intentional.
1587      if (isEmpty(s))
1588         return new String[0];
1589      if (s.indexOf(',') == -1)
1590         return new String[]{s};
1591
1592      var l = new LinkedList<String>();
1593      var sArray = s.toCharArray();
1594      var x1 = 0;
1595      var paramDepth = 0;
1596
1597      for (var i = 0; i < sArray.length; i++) {
1598         var c = s.charAt(i);
1599         if (c == '>')
1600            paramDepth++;
1601         else if (c == '<')
1602            paramDepth--;
1603         else if (c == ',' && paramDepth == 0) {
1604            var s2 = new String(sArray, x1, i-x1);
1605            l.add(s2.trim());
1606            x1 = i+1;
1607         }
1608      }
1609
1610      var s2 = new String(sArray, x1, sArray.length-x1);
1611      l.add(s2.trim());
1612
1613      return l.toArray(new String[l.size()]);
1614   }
1615
1616   /**
1617    * Splits a comma-delimited list containing "nesting constructs".
1618    *
1619    * Nesting constructs are simple embedded "{...}" comma-delimted lists.
1620    *
1621    * Example:
1622    *    "a{b,c},d" -> ["a{b,c}","d"]
1623    *
1624    * Handles escapes and trims whitespace from tokens.
1625    *
1626    * @param s The input string.
1627    *    The results, or <jk>null</jk> if the input was <jk>null</jk>.
1628    *    <br>An empty string results in an empty array.
1629    */
1630   public static List<String> splitNested(String s) {
1631      var escapeChars = StringUtils.getEscapeSet(',');
1632
1633      if (s == null) return null;  // NOSONAR - Intentional.
1634      if (isEmpty(s)) return Collections.emptyList();
1635      if (s.indexOf(',') == -1) return Collections.singletonList(StringUtils.trim(s));
1636
1637      var l = new LinkedList<String>();
1638
1639      var x1 = 0;
1640      var inEscape = false;
1641      var depthCount = 0;
1642
1643      for (var i = 0; i < s.length(); i++) {
1644         var c = s.charAt(i);
1645         if (inEscape) {
1646            if (c == '\\') {
1647               inEscape = false;
1648            }
1649         } else {
1650            if (c == '\\') {
1651               inEscape = true;
1652            } else if (c == '{') {
1653               depthCount++;
1654            } else if (c == '}') {
1655               depthCount--;
1656            } else if (c == ',' && depthCount == 0) {
1657               l.add(StringUtils.trim(StringUtils.unEscapeChars(s.substring(x1, i), escapeChars)));
1658               x1 = i+1;
1659            }
1660         }
1661      }
1662      l.add(StringUtils.trim(StringUtils.unEscapeChars(s.substring(x1, s.length()), escapeChars)));
1663
1664      return l;
1665   }
1666
1667   /**
1668    * Splits a nested comma-delimited list.
1669    *
1670    * Nesting constructs are simple embedded "{...}" comma-delimted lists.
1671    *
1672    * Example:
1673    *    "a{b,c{d,e}}" -> ["b","c{d,e}"]
1674    *
1675    * Handles escapes and trims whitespace from tokens.
1676    *
1677    * @param s The input string.
1678    *    The results, or <jk>null</jk> if the input was <jk>null</jk>.
1679    *    <br>An empty string results in an empty array.
1680    */
1681   public static List<String> splitNestedInner(String s) {
1682      if (s == null) throw illegalArg("String was null.");
1683      if (isEmpty(s)) throw illegalArg("String was empty.");
1684
1685      final int
1686         S1 = 1,  // Looking for '{'
1687         S2 = 2;  // Found '{', looking for '}'
1688
1689      var start = -1;
1690      var end = -1;
1691      var state = S1;
1692      var depth = 0;
1693      var inEscape = false;
1694
1695      for (var i = 0; i < s.length(); i++) {
1696         var c = s.charAt(i);
1697         if (inEscape) {
1698            if (c == '\\') {
1699               inEscape = false;
1700            }
1701         } else {
1702            if (c == '\\') {
1703               inEscape = true;
1704            } else if (state == S1) {
1705               if (c == '{') {
1706                  start = i+1;
1707                  state = S2;
1708               }
1709            } else /* state == S2 */ {
1710               if (c == '{') {
1711                  depth++;
1712               } else if (depth > 0 && c == '}') {
1713                  depth--;
1714               } else if (c == '}') {
1715                  end = i;
1716                  break;
1717               }
1718            }
1719         }
1720      }
1721
1722      if (start == -1) throw illegalArg("Start character '{' not found in string.", s);
1723      if (end == -1) throw illegalArg("End character '}' not found in string.", s);
1724      return splitNested(s.substring(start, end));
1725   }
1726
1727   /**
1728    * Splits a space-delimited string with optionally quoted arguments.
1729    *
1730    * <p>
1731    * Examples:
1732    * <ul>
1733    *    <li><js>"foo"</js> =&gt; <c>["foo"]</c>
1734    *    <li><js>" foo "</js> =&gt; <c>["foo"]</c>
1735    *    <li><js>"foo bar baz"</js> =&gt; <c>["foo","bar","baz"]</c>
1736    *    <li><js>"foo 'bar baz'"</js> =&gt; <c>["foo","bar baz"]</c>
1737    *    <li><js>"foo \"bar baz\""</js> =&gt; <c>["foo","bar baz"]</c>
1738    *    <li><js>"foo 'bar\'baz'"</js> =&gt; <c>["foo","bar'baz"]</c>
1739    * </ul>
1740    *
1741    * @param s The input string.
1742    * @return
1743    *    The results, or <jk>null</jk> if the input was <jk>null</jk>.
1744    *    <br>An empty string results in an empty array.
1745    */
1746   public static String[] splitQuoted(String s) {
1747      return splitQuoted(s, false);
1748   }
1749
1750   /**
1751    * Same as {@link #splitQuoted(String)} but allows you to optionally keep the quote characters.
1752    *
1753    * @param s The input string.
1754    * @param keepQuotes If <jk>true</jk>, quote characters are kept on the tokens.
1755    * @return
1756    *    The results, or <jk>null</jk> if the input was <jk>null</jk>.
1757    *    <br>An empty string results in an empty array.
1758    */
1759   public static String[] splitQuoted(String s, boolean keepQuotes) {
1760
1761      if (s == null)
1762         return null;  // NOSONAR - Intentional.
1763
1764      s = s.trim();
1765
1766      if (isEmpty(s))
1767         return new String[0];
1768
1769      if (! StringUtils.containsAny(s, ' ', '\t', '\'', '"'))
1770         return new String[]{s};
1771
1772      final int
1773         S1 = 1,  // Looking for start of token.
1774         S2 = 2,  // Found ', looking for end '
1775         S3 = 3,  // Found ", looking for end "
1776         S4 = 4;  // Found non-whitespace, looking for end whitespace.
1777
1778      var state = S1;
1779
1780      var isInEscape = false;
1781      var needsUnescape = false;
1782      var mark = 0;
1783
1784      var l = new ArrayList<String>();
1785      for (var i = 0; i < s.length(); i++) {
1786         var c = s.charAt(i);
1787
1788         if (state == S1) {
1789            if (c == '\'') {
1790               state = S2;
1791               mark = keepQuotes ? i : i+1;
1792            } else if (c == '"') {
1793               state = S3;
1794               mark = keepQuotes ? i : i+1;
1795            } else if (c != ' ' && c != '\t') {
1796               state = S4;
1797               mark = i;
1798            }
1799         } else if (state == S2 || state == S3) {
1800            if (c == '\\') {
1801               isInEscape = ! isInEscape;
1802               needsUnescape = ! keepQuotes;
1803            } else if (! isInEscape) {
1804               if (c == (state == S2 ? '\'' : '"')) {
1805                  var s2 = s.substring(mark, keepQuotes ? i+1 : i);
1806                  if (needsUnescape)  // NOSONAR - False positive check.
1807                     s2 = StringUtils.unEscapeChars(s2, StringUtils.QUOTE_ESCAPE_SET);
1808                  l.add(s2);
1809                  state = S1;
1810                  isInEscape = needsUnescape = false;
1811               }
1812            } else {
1813               isInEscape = false;
1814            }
1815         } else /* state == S4 */ {
1816            if (c == ' ' || c == '\t') {
1817               l.add(s.substring(mark, i));
1818               state = S1;
1819            }
1820         }
1821      }
1822      if (state == S4)
1823         l.add(s.substring(mark));
1824      else if (state == S2 || state == S3)
1825         throw new IllegalArgumentException("Unmatched string quotes: " + s);
1826      return l.toArray(new String[l.size()]);
1827   }
1828
1829   /**
1830    * Converts various collection-like objects to a {@link List}.
1831    *
1832    * <p>This utility method enables testing of any collection-like object by converting it to a List that can be
1833    * passed to methods such as TestUtils.assertList().</p>
1834    *
1835    * <h5 class='section'>Supported Input Types:</h5>
1836    * <ul>
1837    *    <li><b>List:</b> Returns the input unchanged</li>
1838    *    <li><b>Iterable:</b> Any collection, set, queue, etc. (converted to List preserving order)</li>
1839    *    <li><b>Iterator:</b> Converts iterator contents to List</li>
1840    *    <li><b>Enumeration:</b> Converts enumeration contents to List</li>
1841    *    <li><b>Stream:</b> Converts stream contents to List (stream is consumed)</li>
1842    *    <li><b>Map:</b> Converts map entries to List of Map.Entry objects</li>
1843    *    <li><b>Array:</b> Converts any array type (including primitive arrays) to List</li>
1844    * </ul>
1845    *
1846    * <h5 class='section'>Usage Examples:</h5>
1847    * <p class='bjava'>
1848    *    <jc>// Test a Set</jc>
1849    *    Set&lt;String&gt; <jv>mySet</jv> = Set.of(<js>"a"</js>, <js>"b"</js>, <js>"c"</js>);
1850    *    assertList(toList(<jv>mySet</jv>), <js>"a"</js>, <js>"b"</js>, <js>"c"</js>);
1851    *
1852    *    <jc>// Test an array</jc>
1853    *    String[] <jv>myArray</jv> = {<js>"x"</js>, <js>"y"</js>, <js>"z"</js>};
1854    *    assertList(toList(<jv>myArray</jv>), <js>"x"</js>, <js>"y"</js>, <js>"z"</js>);
1855    *
1856    *    <jc>// Test a primitive array</jc>
1857    *    <jk>int</jk>[] <jv>numbers</jv> = {1, 2, 3};
1858    *    assertList(toList(<jv>numbers</jv>), <js>"1"</js>, <js>"2"</js>, <js>"3"</js>);
1859    *
1860    *    <jc>// Test a Stream</jc>
1861    *    Stream&lt;String&gt; <jv>myStream</jv> = Stream.of(<js>"foo"</js>, <js>"bar"</js>);
1862    *    assertList(toList(<jv>myStream</jv>), <js>"foo"</js>, <js>"bar"</js>);
1863    *
1864    *    <jc>// Test a Map (converted to entries)</jc>
1865    *    Map&lt;String,Integer&gt; <jv>myMap</jv> = Map.of(<js>"a"</js>, 1, <js>"b"</js>, 2);
1866    *    assertList(toList(<jv>myMap</jv>), <js>"a=1"</js>, <js>"b=2"</js>);
1867    *
1868    *    <jc>// Test any Iterable collection</jc>
1869    *    Queue&lt;String&gt; <jv>myQueue</jv> = new LinkedList&lt;&gt;(List.of(<js>"first"</js>, <js>"second"</js>));
1870    *    assertList(toList(<jv>myQueue</jv>), <js>"first"</js>, <js>"second"</js>);
1871    * </p>
1872    *
1873    * <h5 class='section'>Integration with Testing:</h5>
1874    * <p>This method is specifically designed to work with testing frameworks to provide
1875    * a unified testing approach for all collection-like types. Instead of having separate assertion methods
1876    * for arrays, sets, and other collections, you can convert them all to Lists and use standard
1877    * list assertion methods.</p>
1878    *
1879    * @param o The object to convert to a List. Must not be null and must be a supported collection-like type.
1880    * @return A {@link List} containing the elements from the input object.
1881    * @throws IllegalArgumentException if the input object cannot be converted to a List.
1882    * @see #arrayToList(Object)
1883    */
1884   public static final List<?> toList(Object o) {  // NOSONAR
1885      assertArgNotNull("o", o);
1886      if (o instanceof List<?> o2) return o2;
1887      if (o instanceof Iterable<?> o2) return StreamSupport.stream(o2.spliterator(), false).toList();
1888      if (o instanceof Iterator<?> o2) return StreamSupport.stream(Spliterators.spliteratorUnknownSize(o2, 0), false).toList();
1889      if (o instanceof Enumeration<?> o2) return Collections.list(o2);
1890      if (o instanceof Stream<?> o2) return o2.toList();
1891      if (o instanceof Map<?,?> o2) return toList(o2.entrySet());
1892      if (o instanceof Optional<?> o2) return o2.isEmpty() ? Collections.emptyList() : Collections.singletonList(o2.get());
1893      if (isArray(o)) return arrayToList(o);
1894      throw runtimeException("Could not convert object of type {0} to a list", classNameOf(o));
1895   }
1896
1897   public static boolean isConvertibleToList(Object o) {
1898      return o != null && (o instanceof Collection || o instanceof Iterable || o instanceof Iterator || o instanceof Enumeration || o instanceof Stream || o instanceof Map || o instanceof Optional || isArray(o));
1899   }
1900
1901   /**
1902    * Converts an array to a stream of objects.
1903    * @param array The array to convert.
1904    * @return A new stream.
1905    */
1906   public static Stream<Object> toStream(Object array) {
1907      assertArg(isArray(array), "Arg was not an array.  Type: {0}", array.getClass().getName());
1908      var length = Array.getLength(array);
1909      return IntStream.range(0, length).mapToObj(i -> Array.get(array, i));
1910   }
1911
1912   @SuppressWarnings("rawtypes")
1913   private static <T> T toType(String s, T def) {
1914      if (s == null || def == null)
1915         return null;
1916      var c = (Class<T>)def.getClass();
1917      if (c == String.class)
1918         return (T)s;
1919      if (c.isEnum())
1920         return (T)Enum.valueOf((Class<? extends Enum>) c, s);
1921      var f = (Function<String,T>)ENV_FUNCTIONS.get(c);
1922      if (f == null)
1923         throw runtimeException("Invalid env type: {0}", c);
1924      return f.apply(s);
1925   }
1926
1927   /**
1928    * Traverses all elements in the specified object and executes a consumer for it.
1929    *
1930    * @param <T> The element type.
1931    * @param o The object to traverse.
1932    * @param c The consumer of the objects.
1933    */
1934   public static <T> void traverse(Object o, Consumer<T> c) {
1935      if (o == null)
1936         return;
1937      if (o instanceof Iterable<?> o2)
1938         o2.forEach(x -> traverse(x, c));
1939      else if (o instanceof Stream<?> o2)
1940         o2.forEach(x -> traverse(x, c));
1941      else if (isArray(o))
1942         toStream(o).forEach(x -> traverse(x, c));
1943      else
1944         c.accept((T)o);
1945   }
1946
1947   /**
1948    * Creates an unmodifiable view of the specified list.
1949    *
1950    * <p>This is a null-safe wrapper around {@link Collections#unmodifiableList(List)}.</p>
1951    *
1952    * @param <T> The element type.
1953    * @param value The list to make unmodifiable. Can be null.
1954    * @return An unmodifiable view of the list, or null if the input was null.
1955    */
1956   public static <T> List<T> u(List<? extends T> value) {
1957      return value == null ? null : Collections.unmodifiableList(value);
1958   }
1959
1960   /**
1961    * Creates an unmodifiable view of the specified map.
1962    *
1963    * <p>This is a null-safe wrapper around {@link Collections#unmodifiableMap(Map)}.</p>
1964    *
1965    * @param <K> The key type.
1966    * @param <V> The value type.
1967    * @param value The map to make unmodifiable. Can be null.
1968    * @return An unmodifiable view of the map, or null if the input was null.
1969    */
1970   public static <K,V> Map<K,V> u(Map<? extends K, ? extends V> value) {
1971      return value == null ? null : Collections.unmodifiableMap(value);
1972   }
1973
1974   /**
1975    * Creates an unmodifiable view of the specified set.
1976    *
1977    * <p>This is a null-safe wrapper around {@link Collections#unmodifiableSet(Set)}.</p>
1978    *
1979    * @param <T> The element type.
1980    * @param value The set to make unmodifiable. Can be null.
1981    * @return An unmodifiable view of the set, or null if the input was null.
1982    */
1983   public static <T> Set<T> u(Set<? extends T> value) {
1984      return value == null ? null : Collections.unmodifiableSet(value);
1985   }
1986
1987   /** Constructor - This class is meant to be subclasses. */
1988   protected Utils() {}
1989
1990   /**
1991    * Helper method for creating StringBuilder objects.
1992    *
1993    * @param value The string value to wrap in a StringBuilder.
1994    * @return A new StringBuilder containing the specified value.
1995    */
1996   public static StringBuilder sb(String value) {
1997      return new StringBuilder(value);
1998   }
1999
2000   public static String classNameOf(Object o) {
2001      return o == null ? null : o.getClass().getName();
2002   }
2003
2004   public static String simpleClassNameOf(Object o) {
2005      return o == null ? null : o.getClass().getSimpleName();
2006   }
